alert.note: Alert for Alameda (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 4:43PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Rain will continue through the evening. There have been recent reports of roadway flooding near SR 87 and I280. Will likely continue to see flooding impacts along the highways during the evening commute. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda and Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 730 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.6 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Mountain View, Milpitas, Cupertino, Campbell, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Los Altos, Los Altos Hills, Sunol-Midtown, Buena Vista, Fruitdale, Seven Trees, Alum Rock, East Foothills, Rancho Rinconada Cdp, Monte Sereno and Cambrian Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
